issue.title: Configure nested types as complex types by default

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Issues that have been approved but are not scheduled a specific release.

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
When mapping a complex type hierarchy, the user must currently manually configure each and every non-primitive property as complex; we should consider doing this by convention the moment the top-most containing property is configured as complex.

This is similar to the situation with JSON and owned (one of these must be manually specified for the entire hierarchy). As discussed, I'm assuming that even when we enable regular navigations from complex types out of the complex hierarchy, we'd still not want that to be the default.

rename.from: Add pre-convention model configuration API for complex types
rename.to: Only discover complex types when configured through pre-convention model configuration
